text.section:
The governing body of Calvert County and of a municipal corporation in Calvert County shall grant a tax credit under this section against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on:
real property that is owned by the Calvert Arundel Medical Facility, Incorporated; and
agricultural land, not including any improvements, that is located in an agricultural preservation district.

The governing body of Calvert County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county tax imposed on:
real property that is:
owned by a nonprofit community or civic improvement association or corporation; and
used only for a community, civic, educational, or library purpose, if:
real property that is owned by the Calvert County Sportsmen's Club, Incorporated; and
real property that is:
located in the 2nd election district of Calvert County;
actually used for the Calvert County Fair; and
known as the Calvert County Fairgrounds.

The governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on a building that is:
located on land that qualifies for an agricultural use assessment; and
used in connection with an activity that is recognized by the Department as an approved agricultural activity.

The governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property that is:
owned by the Huntingtown Volunteer Fire Department and Rescue Squad, Incorporated; and
leased to the United States Postal Service for use as a post office.

The governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property that is owned by the Calvert Post No. 85, the American Legion Department of Maryland, Incorporated.

section.section: The governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property that is owned by members of volunteer fire and rescue companies.

The governing body of Calvert County may provide, by law, for:
the amount and duration of the tax credit under this subsection; and
the criteria for qualifying for the tax credit under this subsection.

Subject to subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, the governing body of Calvert County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on real property owned by an expanding or new business that:

If the expanding or new business is engaged in the generation of electricity, the credit under this section may be granted against the county property tax imposed on personal property and real property owned by the expanding or new business.

The tax credit under this section shall be granted to:
a business that owns the land and building it occupies within the county; or
any party responsible for paying the real property taxes on all or part of the land or building.
The amount of the credit may not exceed 50% of the amount of property tax due in any taxable year.
The governing body of Calvert County may define, fix, or limit the amount, terms, scope, and duration of any credit provided for or affirmed under this subsection.
